MathML Attributes¶

MathML elements take attributes with values that further specialize the meaning or effect of the element. Only part of the attributes are listed below, for a full list look at [1].

For example we will use the following equation:

a + b 2 
<math>
  <msup>
    <mfenced> <mbox> <mi>a</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mi>b</mi> </mbox> </mfenced> <mn>2</mn>
  </msup>
</math>

color¶

The color, or background color, of presentation elements may be specified as a color using color=#RGB|#RRGGBB|html-color-name.

a + b 2 
<math>
  <msup>
    <mfenced> <mbox> <mi color='red'>a</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mi>b</mi> </mbox> </mfenced> <mn>2</mn>
  </msup>
</math>

The same result can be achieved using the CSS.

a + b 2 
<math>
  <msup>
    <mfenced> <mbox> <mi style='color:red;'>a</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mi>b</mi> </mbox> </mfenced> <mn>2</mn>
  </msup>
</math>

id¶

Establishes a unique identifier associated with the element to support linking, cross-references and parallel markup.

xref¶

References another element within the document.

class¶

Associates the element with a set of style classes for use with XSLT and CSS.

style¶

Associates style information with the element for use with XSLT and CSS.

href¶

Can be used to establish the element as a hyperlink to the specfied URI.

References

[1]http://www.w3.org/TR/MathML3/chapter2.html
